Module Slope.ECS
Package org.lucasstarsz.slope.system

Class ECSSystemBuilder<T extends ECSSystem>

java.lang.Object
org.lucasstarsz.slope.system.ECSSystemBuilder<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The generic type of the system to create. Uses of T must extend ECSSystem.
public class ECSSystemBuilder<T extends ECSSystem>
extends java.lang.Object
A ECSSystem builder, providing an easy way to create ECS systems.

Before this class, developers were required to handle the signature (as a BitSet) of the system themselves, requiring more work as well as an understanding of bits, bitwise operations, and of using the BitSet class, like so: 


 // Assume TransformComponent, VelocityComponent, and TransformSystem are all classes
 // where TransformComponent and VelocityComponent implement IComponent, and
 // TransformSystem extends ECSSystem.
 //
 // Also assume our World variable is called world, and it has all specified components
 // already registered.

 TransformSystem transformSystem = world.registerSystem(TransformSystem.class);

 BitSet transformSystemSignature = new BitSet();
 transformSystemSignature.set(world.getComponentType(TransformComponent.class));
 transformSystemSignature.set(world.getComponentType(VelocityComponent.class));
 world.setSystemSignature(TransformSystem.class, transformSystemSignature);

 // we can now use transformSystem
 // hopefully we didn't forget anything...

I felt this was too much of a hassle for a developer to deal with, unless they really want to get into the nitty-gritty of the ECS. It furthermore raises the entry barrier overtop newer developers who don't have experience with bits and bit operations.

As a result, I developed this builder class, allowing the user a more readable interface for creating a system. The result: 


 // assume the same as last time

 TransformSystem transformSystem = new ECSSystemBuilder<>(world, TransformSystem.class)
         .withComponent(TransformComponent.class)
         .withComponent(VelocityComponent.class)
         .build();

 // we can now use transformSystem, woohoo!

  • Constructor Details

    • ECSSystemBuilder

      public ECSSystemBuilder​(World world, java.lang.Class<T> systemClass)
      Constructs an ECSSystemBuilder with the specified ecs world and the class of the system to create.
      Parameters:
      world - The ecs world to create a system for.
      systemClass - The class of the system to create.

    • ECSSystemBuilder

      public ECSSystemBuilder​(World world, java.lang.Class<T> systemClass, java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Class<?>,​java.lang.Object> arguments)
      Constructs an ECSSystemBuilder with the specified ecs world and the class of the system to create, as well as arguments to instantiate the system if needed.

      For information about the arguments parameter, see ECSSystemManager.registerSystem(Class, LinkedHashMap).

      Parameters:
      world - The ecs world to create a system for.
      systemClass - The class of the system to create.
      arguments - The arguments to construct the system.

  • Method Details

    • withComponent

      public <U extends IComponent> ECSSystemBuilder<T> withComponent​(java.lang.Class<U> componentClass)
      Adds a possible component to the system.

      Each component added in this way decides what entities are allowed in the resulting system. All entities in a given system are guaranteed to have the components added in this way.

      Type Parameters:
      U - The generic type of the component to register. Uses of U must implement IComponent.
      Parameters:
      componentClass - The class of the component to add.
      Returns:
      The builder, in order to chain method calls.

    • build

      public T build()
      Finalizes the creation and signature of the system, returning it for use.
      Returns:
      The resulting ECSSystem.
